lessons: Test setup.sh in the harness repo itself to catch inception issues
Consider upgrade path when making breaking changes
Delete unused code (templates) rather than trying to sync it
Never trust self-assessment - always run actual verification commands
Loop state must persist across context windows
Both setup.sh AND commands/setup.md must be updated together

entries.approach: Hybrid augmentation: Mandelbrot algorithms enhance existing Turing's Maze orchestration without breaking changes
patterns: Instruction-based orchestration can be enhanced with mathematical convergence concepts
Mandelbrot escape-time, fractal decomposition, and convergence detection work as planning layer
Verification greps should check for conceptual function names, not actual bash functions in markdown
lessons: Markdown instructions require different verification than bash scripts - check for concept names, not function signatures
Hybrid models (Turing + Mandelbrot) provide complementary strengths: determinism + adaptivity
Comprehensive 14-step plan enabled systematic implementation in single attempt
Documentation of mathematical basis helps future understanding and maintenance
